definition: affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
collateralized debt obligation (CDO), type of bond
pinyin: zhai4 wu4 dan1 bao3 zheng4 quan4

definition: debt security/collateralized debt obligation (CDO), type of bond

sentences.english: The treaty fixed the permitted ratio of government debt-to-GDP at 60 percent.
sentences.chinese: 條約規定政府債務率最高可爲60%。

sentences.english: And Republican leaders say that they agree we must avoid default.
sentences.chinese: 共和黨領導人說，他們同意我們必須避免債務欠付。

sentences.english: Fourth, we will continue to strengthen management of local government debt.
sentences.chinese: 四是繼續加強地方政府性債務管理。

sentences.english: What if I have no debts?
What Beijing will do about the unofficial financial system is anyone's guess at this point.
sentences.chinese: 北京如何處理這些非官方債務，任誰都猜得到。

sentences.english: Implicitly, the UK government is guaranteeing the liabilities of the swollen UK banks.
sentences.chinese: 含蓄地說，英國政府在爲英國銀行庸腫的債務作保。

sentences.english: Dubai World has 70 creditors who could face write-downs on their debt.
sentences.chinese: 迪拜世界有70個債權人可能面臨債務減抵。

sentences.english: Net worth is defined as assets minus liabilities.
sentences.chinese: 這裏淨資產是指資產減去債務。

sentences.english: German banks are balking at writing off Greek debt.
sentences.chinese: 德國各家銀行在勾銷希臘債務方面畏縮不前。

sentences.english: However, the assignor may be liable to the obligor for breach of contract.
sentences.chinese: 但是，讓與人可能因而向債務人承擔違約義務。

sentences.english: They also called for legally enshrined debt brakes in all eurozone countries.
sentences.chinese: 他們還要求在所有歐元區國家立法實現“債務制動”。

sentences.english: There is no doubt that debt outstanding performance-based market has been concerned about.
sentences.chinese: 沒有出色表現的債務爲基礎的市場一直關注疑問。

sentences.english: Pay off all high interest debt, such as credit cards.
sentences.chinese: 還清所有高利息的債務，例如信用卡。

sentences.english: Debt collectors buy old debts from companies or lenders for pennies on the dollar.
sentences.chinese: 債主從公司收舊賬或者跟債務人討小錢。

sentences.english: Some homeowners are delinquent, or unable to make the payments on costly, exotic mortgages they took out during the boom.
sentences.chinese: 一些屋主拖欠債務，或者無力支付高額的按揭款。

definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to be in debt/to incur debts/liability (finance)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
